intro: Calea longifolia, commonly known as the "flower of the night," is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is characterized by its striking white, tubular flowers that open at night and close during the day. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its aromatic foliage. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. Calea longifolia is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its distinctive nocturnal blooming habit.
